alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 9:56PM EDT until April 10 at 2:52AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale...down to Shoals. White River at Newberry...down to Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Elliston. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the East Fork White River from Rivervale to Shoals....and along the White River at Elliston to Hazleton. Moderate flooding is occurring on the White River at Petersburg...and is forecast to start at Hazleton midday Friday. Moderate flooding is expected to end on the White River on Sunday. The crest on the East Fork White River will pass from Williams to Shoals tonight...while the crest on the White River will slowly pass Petersburg late Friday. Minor flooding is expected to end on the East Fork White River early next week...and on the White River at Greene County points tonight...while continuing at Edwardsport and points downriver through at least next week. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Friday. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, APRIL 10... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Monday, April 10. * IMPACTS...At 24.3 feet, During April 2013 when Petersburg reached this level, the water only reached the white line of SR 257 south of Washington, but never closed the road. Shoals only went to 11.67 feet during April 2013. This is the first that locals can remember such a high stage for Petersburg and SR 257 remaining open. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Thursday /7:45 PM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 23.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EDT Thursday /7:45 PM CDT Thursday/ was 23.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, April 09. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
